Important Information for our Virtual Students

We are excited to start the 2020-21 school year! This summer, our teams have been working hard to come up with a plan that meets requirements to keep our students safe in traditional school and an exciting option that allows our students to choose to complete their education in a fully virtual format for the first semester!

Virtual learning, with all of the coursework 100% online, is a new experience for all of us! This is the first time that we have offered this option at Homer Community Schools. We know that you will have lots of questions! We will, too! But we are excited to go through this process together with you. We are also very happy to report that all of your teachers will be current Homer Community Schools teachers. So you will continue to be as connected as possible to all things Homer!

Please read through all of this information to help you be prepared for success!!!

Earlier this morning, Governor Gretchen Whitmer signed an executive order closing all K-12 school buildings for face-to-face learning for the remainder of the school year. This means that all school buildings, student activities and events are canceled or postponed through May 29.
